agent.name: classification
agent.role: Extract raw metadata from personal documents using semantic analysis and domain taxonomy. Focus on accurate classification before standardization.

domain.name: financial
domain.description: Core financial instruments and accounts (banking, investments, credit, retirement, tax)
domain.category: mortgages, auto loans, student loans, personal loans
federal returns, state returns, W-2s, 1099s, tax receipts, supporting documentation

domain.name: property
domain.description: Real and personal property ownership (real estate, vehicles, major assets, household items)
domain.category: expensive purchases: appliances, jewelry, collections, electronics
everyday inexpensive household items: furniture, bedding, kitchenware, decor, linens, small appliances

domain.name: insurance
domain.description: All insurance policies and coverage (health, property/casualty, life/disability)
domain.category: life insurance, disability insurance, long-term care

domain.name: legal
domain.description: Identity documents, estate planning, legal agreements
domain.category: birth certificates, passports, Social Security cards
contracts, legal settlements, powers of attorney

domain.name: medical
domain.description: Healthcare records, medical expenses, health insurance documentation

domain.name: employment
domain.category: health benefits, retirement plans, stock options

doctypes.doctype: Regular periodic summaries (bank statements, investment statements, credit card statements)
Proof of payment for goods or services
Insurance coverage documents, terms and conditions
Medical test results, inspection reports, appraisals

metadata.field: Company, institution, or entity name as it appears in the document (e.g., "Bank of America", "Dr. John Smith", "State Farm Insurance")

Single most relevant date following this priority: (1) Statement/invoice/document date, (2) Transaction/service date, (3) Period ending date, (4) Due date, (5) Generated/printed date. Extract in whatever format it appears (e.g., "01/31/2025", "January 31, 2025", or "2025-01-31")
Purpose or subject matter of the document (e.g., "wire transfer", "annual physical", "kitchen renovation", "oil change")

guidelines.guideline: Focus on the primary purpose of the document - if a medical receipt could also be a tax deduction, classify it as Medical (domain) first
Extract the most relevant date using the priority hierarchy - document date over transaction date over period date
Keep vendor names as they appear - standardization will happen in a later step
For subject matter, capture the specific purpose to differentiate similar documents from same vendor
Distinguish between household (everyday inexpensive items like bedding, plates, small furniture) and major_assets (expensive purchases like high-end appliances, jewelry, collections)

vendor_extraction.guideline: Extract the primary entity providing the service/product/document
For property: use property address, not seller/county recorder
For medical: prefer provider over facility (unless facility is provider)
For legal: use law firm/attorney if document preparer
For receipts: use merchant name, not parent corporation
Keep as it appears - do NOT standardize

case.scenario: Document prepared by law firm for client
Medical service by 'Dr. John Smith at City Hospital'
Property deed for '123 Main Street' sold by 'John Doe'
Insurance policy from 'State Farm Insurance Agent: Bob Smith'

subject_extraction.purpose: Capture the specific purpose or subject matter to differentiate similar documents from same vendor/period. Focus on WHAT the document is about (content, result, thing), NOT the action performed.

core_principle.rule: Subject describes the CONTENT/RESULT, not the ACTION

granularity.guideline: For financial: Include account type (checking, savings, credit, IRA) - the thing being managed
For medical: Include service type (annual physical, surgery, lab work) - the service received (result)
For property: Include what was obtained/done (groceries, electronics, kitchen_reno) - the items or completed work
For insurance: Include coverage type (homeowners, auto, life) - the coverage itself
For tax: Include form type or document purpose (1040, W-2, donation) - the document/thing itself
For legal: Include document purpose (will, contract, agreement) - the document type

good_vs_bad.context: Multiple bank statements from same institution
Multiple medical visits to same doctor

case.scenario: Medical receipt with large amount (potential tax deduction)
case.rationale: Primary purpose is healthcare expense tracking; tax is secondary
HSA is financial instrument; health context handled via subject_raw
Primary archival purpose is tax filing
Policy coverage is primary; property context in subject_raw

case.action: Use document issuer, property address, or 'unknown' if truly unclear
Extract file metadata date, current date, or 'undated'
Choose primary domain by archival purpose, capture secondary in subject_raw
Classify by the primary/majority content purpose
Extract what's readable, make best judgment
Household: everyday items (bedding, kitchenware, small furniture). Major_assets: expensive purchases (high-end appliances, jewelry, collections, electronics)
